    "let @xmath0 be an oriented surface of finite topological type without boundary .",
    "the _ kauffman bracket skein algebra _",
    "@xmath6 depends on a parameter @xmath79 , and is defined as follows : one first considers the vector space freely generated by all isotopy classes of framed links in the thickened surface @xmath80 $ ] , and then one takes the quotient of this space by two relations .",
    "the first and main relation is the _ skein relation _ , which states that @xmath81 = a^{-1 } [ k_0 ] + a [ k_\\infty]\\ ] ] whenever the three links @xmath82 , @xmath83 and @xmath84 $ ] differ only in a little ball where they are as represented in figure  [ fig : skeinrelation ] , and where @xmath85 $ ] denotes the class of @xmath6 represented by the framed link @xmath29 .",
    "the second relation is the _ trivial knot relation _ , which asserts that @xmath86 = -(a^2 + a^{-2})[k]\\ ] ] whenever @xmath87 is the boundary of a disk @xmath88 $ ] disjoint from @xmath29 , and is endowed with a framing transverse to @xmath89 .",
    "( .5 * -.4 ) @xmath83 + ( .1 * -.4 ) @xmath82 + ( .9 * -.4 ) @xmath90 +    the algebra multiplication is provided by the operation of superposition , where the product @xmath85\\cdot [ l]$ ] is represented by the union @xmath91 $ ] where @xmath92 $ ] and @xmath93 $ ] are respectively obtained by rescaling the framed links @xmath94 $ ] and @xmath95 $ ] .",
    "the character variety @xmath15 and the skein algebra @xmath6 both admit natural actions of the cohomology group @xmath62 . indeed , for a character @xmath4 represented by a homomorphism @xmath5 and a cohomology class @xmath64 , its image @xmath96 is represented by the homomorphism @xmath97 defined by @xmath98 for every @xmath19 .",
    "the action of @xmath62 on @xmath6 is similarly defined by the property that @xmath99 = [ ( -1)^{{\\varepsilon}(k ) } k ] \\in { \\mathcal s^a}(s)\\ ] ] for every framed link @xmath100 $ ] and @xmath64 .",
    "if the character @xmath4 is fixed under the action of some @xmath64 , we say that @xmath64 is a _ sign - reversal symmetry _ for the character @xmath4 .",
    "this is equivalent to the property that the trace @xmath101 is equal to @xmath102 for every @xmath19 with @xmath103 .    because of our assumption that @xmath11 is odd , the chebyshev polynomial @xmath22 is a sum of monomials of odd degree .",
    "it follows that , if the representation @xmath12 has classical shadow @xmath4 , its composition @xmath65 with the action of @xmath64 on @xmath6 has classical shadow @xmath104 .",
    "in particular , if the classical shadow @xmath4 of the representation @xmath12 has a sign - reversal symmetry @xmath64 , the representation @xmath65 also has classical shadow @xmath105 .",
    "sign - reversal symmetries of a character @xmath73 are therefore intrinsic symmetries of the problem of finding representations of @xmath6 with classical shadow @xmath16 , which explains why they will occur in many statements of our article .",
    "characters with non - trivial sign - reversal symmetries exist , but are rare .",
    "for instance , they form an algebraic subset of complex dimension @xmath106 in the @xmath107dimensional character variety @xmath15 , where @xmath77 is the genus of the surface @xmath0 ; see @xcite .",
    "throughout the article , @xmath20 will be a primitive @xmath11root of @xmath21 with @xmath11 odd .",
    "namely , @xmath13 and @xmath11 is the smallest positive integer with this property ( and @xmath11 is odd ) .",
    "we also use a choice of square root @xmath108 .",
    "let @xmath36 be a triangulation of the closed oriented surface @xmath0 .",
    "for most of the article , we are allowing an edge to go from one vertex to itself , as well as two edges to have the same endpoints .",
    "however , we will always require that the sides of a face of @xmath36 correspond to three distinct edges , for reasons that will become apparent in remark  [ rem : edgesunivcoverdistinctendpoints ] .",
    "we will sometimes restrict attention to triangulations where each edge has distinct endpoints , and where distinct edges have distinct pairs of endpoints . in this case",
    ", we will say that the triangulation is _ combinatorial _ , since this corresponds to the usual convention of combinatorial piecewise linear topology .",
    "let @xmath109 , @xmath110 ,  , @xmath111 be the edges of @xmath36 .",
    "after choosing an auxiliary number @xmath112 such that @xmath113 , the _ chekhov - fock algebra _ of @xmath36 is the algebra @xmath114 defined by generators @xmath115 , @xmath116 ,  , @xmath117 respectively associated to the edges @xmath109 , @xmath110 ,  , @xmath111 of @xmath36 , and by the relations @xmath118 where @xmath119 and where @xmath120 is the number of times an end of the edge @xmath121 immediately succeeds an end of @xmath122 when going counterclockwise around a vertex of @xmath36 .",
    "an element of the chekhov - fock algebra @xmath114 is a linear combination of monomials @xmath123 in the generators @xmath124 , with @xmath125 , @xmath126 ,  , @xmath127 .",
    "such a monomial @xmath128 is _ balanced _ if its exponents @xmath129 satisfy the following parity condition : for every triangle @xmath130 of the ideal triangulation @xmath36 , the sum @xmath131 of the exponents of the generators @xmath132 , @xmath133 , @xmath134 associated to the sides of @xmath130 is even .    the _ balanced chekhov - fock algebra _",
    "@xmath55 of the triangulation @xmath36 is the subalgebra of @xmath114 generated by all monomials satisfying this parity condition .",
    "there are two reasons to be interested in the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 , whose combination is particularly useful for our purposes .",
    "the first one is the existence of an injective algebra homomorphism @xmath135 from the skein algebra of the punctured surface @xmath136 , obtained by removing from @xmath0 the set @xmath137 of vertices of @xmath36 , to the algebra @xmath55 ; this _ quantum trace homomorphism _",
    "@xmath138 is constructed in @xcite .",
    "the second reason is that the algebraic structure of @xmath55 is fairly simple , so that its representations are easily classified ( see @xcite , and the next section ) .",
    "this enables us to obtain representations of @xmath139 by composing the quantum trace homomorphism @xmath138 with suitable representations of @xmath55 .",
    "we will then show that these representations of the skein algebra @xmath139 of the punctured surface @xmath35 induce representations of the skein algebra @xmath6 of the closed surface @xmath0 , which is the object of interest to us .",
    "because of the skew - commutativity relations @xmath140 , the order of the variables in a monomial @xmath141 is quite important .",
    "we will make heavy use of the following symmetrization trick .",
    "the _ weyl quantum ordering _ for @xmath141 is the monomial @xmath142 = \\omega^{-\\sum_{u < v } n_un_v\\sigma_{i_ui_v } } z_{i_1}^{n_1}z_{i_2}^{n_2 } \\dots z_{i_l}^{n_l}.\\ ] ] the formula is specially designed that @xmath143   \\in { \\mathcal t^\\omega}(\\lambda)$ ] is invariant under any permutation of the  @xmath144 .      we are given a character @xmath4 , represented by a homomorphism @xmath146 , and a triangulation @xmath36 of the closed surface @xmath0 .",

    "for every edge @xmath157 of @xmath148 , the elements @xmath158 and @xmath159 respectively associated to the end points @xmath160 and @xmath161 of @xmath157 are distinct .",
    "[ rem : edgesunivcoverdistinctendpoints ] note an easy consequence of our assumption that the sides of each face of a triangulation @xmath36 correspond to three distinct edges . if @xmath162 is an edge of @xmath36 whose endpoints are equal to the same vertex @xmath163 , an euler characteristic argument shows that the closed loop formed by @xmath162 can not bound a disk in @xmath0 . as a consequence",
    "every edge @xmath157 of @xmath151 has distinct endpoints , which makes condition  ( 2 ) above more likely . also , for the same reason , every edge @xmath162 of @xmath36 whose endpoints are equal determines a non - trivial element of @xmath145 , well - defined up to conjugation .",

    "quantum ordering under permutation , the central element @xmath210 associated to the vertex @xmath163 can be written as @xmath285 $ ] .",
    "we want to compute the precise quantum ordering coefficient in this expression .",
    "[ lem : quantumorderh ] let the edges of @xmath36 emerging from the vertex @xmath163 be indexed as @xmath259 , @xmath260 , ",
    ", @xmath261 in counterclockwise order around @xmath163 .",
    "then , the central element @xmath210 associated to @xmath163 is equal to @xmath286    the proof is straightforward when the edges @xmath287 are all distinct , and in particular when the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial . indeed , in this case , @xmath288 whenever @xmath289 , @xmath290 , and all other pairs of generators @xmath291 , @xmath292 commute .",
    "the general case could be deduced from this one with the change of triangulation techniques developed in   [ subsect : facesubdivisions ] and [ subsect : diagonalexchanges ] , but we prefer to give a combinatorial proof right away .",
    "see also the very indirect argument that we used in the proof of ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemma  18 ) .    by definition of the weyl",
    "quantum ordering , @xmath293   = \\omega^{-\\sum_{1{\\leqslant}k < l { \\leqslant}u } \\sigma_{i_ki_l } } z_{i_1}z_{i_2}\\dots z_{i_u}\\ ] ] where the skew commutativity coefficient @xmath294 is defined as in  [ subsect : chefock ] , and in particular is such that @xmath140 .    by definition of @xmath295 , we can write @xmath296 where , for every angular sector @xmath297 of a triangle @xmath130 that is locally bounded by the edges @xmath287 and @xmath298 near the vertex of @xmath297 , @xmath299 is equal to @xmath300 if one goes from @xmath287 to @xmath298 counterclockwise at @xmath297 , and is equal to @xmath21 otherwise .",
    "the angular sectors @xmath297 contributing to this sum include the angular sectors @xmath301 , @xmath302 ,  , @xmath303 that are adjacent to @xmath163 , indexed in such a way that @xmath304 is locally bounded by the edges @xmath287 and @xmath305 near @xmath163",
    ". there may be contributions from additional angular sectors when the edges @xmath287 are not distinct .",
    "fixing an index @xmath306 , we want to analyze its contribution @xmath307 to the above sum .",
    "if an index @xmath308 contributes to @xmath309 , then the edge @xmath287 is contained in a face of @xmath36 that also contains @xmath298 , and one of the two edges @xmath310 is also contained in the same face . analyzing the possible configurations in the union of the two faces of @xmath36 containing @xmath298 , we see that most of the couples @xmath311 contributing to the sum can be grouped into pairs    1 .",
    "@xmath312 when the angular sector @xmath313 is opposite @xmath298 in a face of @xmath36 , and where @xmath314 and @xmath315 are the other two angular sectors of this face ; 2 .",
    "@xmath316 when @xmath317 .",
    "the first type of pair @xmath312 contributes @xmath318 .",
    "the second type @xmath316 contributes @xmath319 . in particular , the corresponding terms cancel out .",
    "the only terms that do not cancel out in such a pair are those where the potential pair would involve an index that is not in the interval @xmath320 $ ] .",
    "this always occurs for @xmath321 , and for @xmath322 when @xmath323 .",
    "a more special instance arises when the angular sector @xmath324 is opposite @xmath298 in a face of @xmath36 , in which case @xmath325 can not be cancelled by a term @xmath326 .",
    "similarly , when @xmath327 or @xmath328 with @xmath329 , the terms @xmath330 or @xmath331 , respectively , are not cancelled by another term .    using our convention that the three sides of each face of the triangulation @xmath36 are all distinct , one easily sees that these are the only terms that do not cancel out .",
    "note that , outside of @xmath321 , all the other exceptions occur precisely when the face of @xmath36 containing the angular sector @xmath324 also contains the edge @xmath298 .",
    "summing over @xmath306 and combining the above observations , it follows that @xmath332 where @xmath333 is the number of indices @xmath334 $ ] for which the edge @xmath298 is opposite the angular sector @xmath324 in the face that contains it , and @xmath335 is the number of indices @xmath334 $ ] for which the edge @xmath298 is adjacent to @xmath324 .",
    "now , consider the face of @xmath36 that contains the angular sector @xmath324 .",
    "there are three cases to consider , according to whether 1 , 2 or 3 of the vertices of this face are equal to @xmath163 .",
    "an immediate count gives that @xmath336 in all three cases .",
    "this proves that @xmath337 and completes the proof of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderh ] .",
    "this combinatorial proof of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderh ] also enables us to compute the weyl quantum ordering of monomials similar to the central element @xmath202 .",
    "these computations will be used in  [ bigsect : dimensionoffdiagonalkernel ] .",
    "[ lem : quantumorderatvertex ] let the edges of @xmath36 emerging from the vertex @xmath163 be indexed as @xmath259 , @xmath260 , ",
    ", @xmath261 in counterclockwise order around @xmath163 .",
    "then , for every @xmath338 with @xmath339 , @xmath340= \\begin{cases } \\omega^{-k_0 + 1 } z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_{k_0 } } & \\text { if } e_{i_{k_0}}\\neq e_{i_1 } \\text { and } e_{i_{k_0 + 1}}\\neq e_{i_u}\\\\ \\omega^{-k_0 + 2 } z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_{k_0 } } & \\text { if } e_{i_{k_0}}= e_{i_1 } \\\\ \\omega^{-k_0 } z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_{k_0 } } & \\text { if }   e_{i_{k_0 + 1}}= e_{i_u}. \\end{cases}\\ ] ]    in particular , @xmath341= \\omega^{-k_0 + 1 } z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots , z_{i_{k_0}}$ ] if the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial .    by definition of the weyl quantum ordering , @xmath342   = \\omega^{-\\sum_{1{\\leqslant}k < l { \\leqslant}k_0 } \\sigma_{i_ki_l } } z_{i_1}z_{i_2}\\dots z_{i_{k_0}}.\\ ] ] the same arguments as in the proof of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderh",

    "the fact that indices are truncated at @xmath338 introduces minor differences with the case of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderh ] .",
    "more precisely , the case - by - case analysis now gives that @xmath346 the stated computation immediately follows .",
    "we are now ready to prove the promised result , that the off - diagonal kernel @xmath347 depends only on the vertex @xmath163 .",
    "[ lem : offdiagkernelwelldefined ] the off - diagonal kernel @xmath348 of @xmath163 is independent of the counterclockwise indexing of the edges @xmath259 , @xmath260 ,  , @xmath261 , @xmath349 of @xmath36 around the vertex @xmath163 .",

    "we restrict attention to the case where the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial .",

    "[ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] suppose that the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial , in the sense that every edge has distinct endpoints and that no two distinct edges have the same endpoints .",
    "then , the off - diagonal kernel @xmath275 of each vertex @xmath163 of @xmath36 is invariant under @xmath362 .",

    "we want to show that @xmath382\\bigr ) = \\mu \\circ { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega\\bigl ( [ k]\\bigr)$ ] respects @xmath275 and , for this , we first need to understand the quantum trace @xmath383\\bigr)\\in { \\mathcal z^\\omega}(\\lambda)$ ]",
    ". the precise construction of @xmath383\\bigr)$ ] in @xcite can be somewhat elaborate , and we first isotop @xmath29 to a position where the quantum trace is easier to analyze .",
    "because there are no identifications on the boundary of the neighborhood @xmath364 , we can arrange by an isotopy that the intersection of @xmath29 with @xmath384 $ ] consists of finitely many horizontal arcs @xmath385 , @xmath386 ,  , @xmath387 , where each @xmath388 is an embedded arc that turns around one of the boundary vertices of @xmath364 , in the sense that @xmath389 goes from some boundary edge @xmath390 of @xmath364 to the next @xmath391 , crosses the internal edge @xmath392 in one point , and meets no other edge of @xmath36 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : vertexstar ] .",
    "in addition , we can arrange that these horizontal arcs @xmath393 sit at increasing elevations @xmath394 $ ] as @xmath306 goes from 1 to @xmath395 .",
    "then the state sum formula of @xcite expresses @xmath383\\bigr)$ ] as a sum of terms of the form @xmath396 where each term corresponds to a state for the boundary of @xmath397\\bigr)$ ] , where @xmath398 is the contribution of the arc @xmath389 , and where @xmath399 is the contribution of the complement of @xmath397\\bigr)$ ] in @xmath29 .",

    "this expression has the unfortunate feature that , although the terms @xmath398 and @xmath399 are elements of the chekhov - fock algebra @xmath401 , they do not satisfy the exponent parity condition necessary to make them elements of the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 .",

    "( the only case that requires some thought is when @xmath417 , in which case it suffices to note that @xmath409 commutes with @xmath418 . ) this enables us to rewrite @xmath419 where @xmath420 involves only generators @xmath124 corresponding to edges @xmath122 of @xmath36 that are outside of @xmath364 .    by construction",

    "each @xmath422 is also an element of @xmath55 since all its exponents are even .",

    "in particular , we can now consider the endomorphisms @xmath424 , @xmath425 , @xmath426 .",
    "we want to show that all these endomorphisms respect the off - diagonal kernel @xmath427 .",

    ".    in @xmath405 , the contribution @xmath430 of each arc @xmath389 commutes with each of the generators @xmath428 corresponding to edges emanating from the vertex @xmath163 .",

    "[ rem : offdiagkernelinvariantweakerhyp ] although the hypotheses of proposition  [ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] require that the triangulation @xmath36 be combinatorial , the proof shows that this statement is valid under the weaker hypothesis that no edge of @xmath36 connects the vertex @xmath163 to itself , and that no two distinct edges connect @xmath163 to the same vertex of @xmath36 .",
    "we will use this observation in ",
    "[ subsect : facesubdivisions ] .",
    "we now consider the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath456 .",
    "let @xmath457 be the representation associated in ",
    "[ subsect : representingpunctsurfskein ] to a homomorphism @xmath5 endowed with a @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 . assuming that the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial , proposition  [ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] shows that the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath458 is invariant under the image @xmath459 . for every framed link @xmath213 $ ]",
    ", we can therefore consider the restriction @xmath460 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda}}\\in { \\mathrm{end}}(f_\\lambda)$ ] .",
    "we now show that @xmath460 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda}}\\in { \\mathrm{end}}(f_\\lambda)$ ] remains invariant if we modify @xmath29 by an isotopy in @xmath461 $ ] , not just in @xmath381 $ ] .",
    "[ prop : vertexsweep ] suppose that the triangulation @xmath36 is combinatorial , in the sense that each edge has distinct endpoints and that no two distinct edges have the same endpoints .",
    "let the two framed links @xmath29 , @xmath462 $ ] be isotopic in @xmath44 $ ]",
    ". then @xmath460 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } = \\rho_\\lambda \\bigl ( [ k ' ] \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda}}$ ] in @xmath463 .",
    "again , the hypothesis that @xmath36 is combinatorial is here only to simplify the proof , and the property holds without this condition ; see theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] in  [ subsect : constructskeinreparbitrarytriangulation ] .",
    "we can choose the isotopy from @xmath29 to @xmath464 so that it sweeps through punctures of @xmath35 at only finitely many times .",
    "this reduces the problem to the case where the isotopy sweeps only once through a puncture .",
    "let @xmath163 be the vertex of the triangulation @xmath36 corresponding to this puncture .",
    "we will be using the same labeling conventions as in the proof of proposition  [ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] .",
    "in particular , @xmath364 denotes the union of the faces of @xmath36 that contain @xmath163 .",
    "the edges emanating from @xmath163 are indexed as @xmath259 , @xmath260 ,  ,",
    "@xmath261 in counterclockwise order around @xmath163 .",
    "the edges of the boundary of @xmath364 are @xmath365 , @xmath366 ,  , @xmath367 , where @xmath369 is the third side of the face containing @xmath368 and @xmath277 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : vertexsweep ] .    since the skeins @xmath85 $ ] , @xmath465 \\in { \\mathcal s^a}(s_\\lambda)$ ] are invariant under isotopy in @xmath381 $ ] , we can restrict attention to the case of figure  [ fig : vertexsweep ] , where the two pieces of @xmath29 and @xmath464 represented are endowed with the vertical framing , and where the remaining portions of @xmath29 and @xmath464 coincide and",
    "are located in @xmath381 $ ] at lower elevations than the pieces represented .",
    "( .69 * .16 ) @xmath370 + ( .31 * .17 ) @xmath371 + ( .16 * .38 ) @xmath466 + ( .84 * .35 ) @xmath372 + ( .5 * -.01 ) @xmath373 + ( .86 * .11 ) @xmath374 + ( .18 * .11 ) @xmath375 + ( .57*.68 ) @xmath379 + ( .49*.31 ) @xmath467 +    these elevation conventions greatly simplify the computation of the quantum trace @xmath468\\bigr)$ ] , because we do not have to worry about correction factors coming from biangles .",

    "the principles are the same , but everything is much simpler because the framed knot @xmath464 meets many fewer edges of @xmath36 . in particular , the expression of @xmath484 \\bigr)$ ] is much less cumbersome , and gives @xmath485 \\bigr ) =   b_{+- } z_{k_1 } ( -\\omega^{-1 }   ) z_{k_1}^{-1 } +   b_{-+ } z_{k_1}^{-1 } ( \\omega^{-5 } ) z_{k_1 }   = \\omega^{-1 }   b_{+- }   -   \\omega^{-5 } b_{-+}\\ ] ] where the terms @xmath470 are contributions of the parts of the link @xmath464 that are not represented on figure  [ fig : vertexsweep ] , and are the same as those that appeared in the computation of @xmath486 \\bigr)$ ] since these `` hidden parts '' of the links @xmath29 and @xmath464 coincide .    as a consequence , @xmath487 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } }",
    "= \\mu_\\lambda \\circ { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega \\bigl ( [ k ' ] \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } = \\omega^{-1 }   \\mu_\\lambda(b_{+-})_{|f_\\lambda } - \\omega^{-5 } \\mu_\\lambda(b_{-+ } ) _ { |{f_\\lambda}}.\\ ] ]    comparing the two formulas , we see that @xmath488 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } =   \\rho_\\lambda\\bigl ( [ k ' ] \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } $ ] , which completes the proof of proposition  [ prop : vertexsweep ] .",
    "[ rem : vertexsweepweakerhyp ] as in remark  [ rem : offdiagkernelinvariantweakerhyp ] , the proof of proposition  [ prop : vertexsweep ] is valid under a weaker hypothesis than the requirement that the triangulation @xmath36 be combinatorial .",
    "indeed , the following condition is sufficent for the statement to hold : no edge of @xmath36 connects the vertex @xmath163 to itself , and no two distinct edges connect @xmath163 to the same vertex of @xmath36 .",
    "we will use this observation in ",
    "[ subsect : facesubdivisions ] .",
    "a consequence of proposition  [ prop : vertexsweep ] is that the representation @xmath489 induces a representation @xmath490 by the property that @xmath491 \\bigr ) = \\rho_\\lambda\\bigl ( [ k ] \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } \\in   { \\mathrm{end}}({f_\\lambda}).\\ ] ]    [ prop : classicalshadowokcombinatorial ] the above representation @xmath492 has classical shadow @xmath4 , in the sense that @xmath493 ) \\bigr ) = - { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r(k)\\ , { \\mathrm{id}}_{f_\\lambda}\\ ] ] for every framed knot @xmath213 $ ] whose projection to @xmath35 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical .",
    "let @xmath213 $ ] be a framed knot whose projection to @xmath35 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical . by definition of the representation @xmath251 and of @xmath494 , and in particular by condition  ( 4 ) of proposition",
    "[ prop : constructrepchefock ] , @xmath40 ) \\bigr ) = - { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r(k)\\ , { \\mathrm{id}}_{e_\\lambda}.\\ ] ] in particular , by restriction to the off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 , @xmath493 ) \\bigr ) = t_n \\bigl ( \\rho_\\lambda ( [ k ] ) \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } = - { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r(k)\\ , { \\mathrm{id}}_{f_\\lambda}. \\qedhere\\ ] ]    at this point , it looks like we are almost done with the proof of theorem  [ thm : realizeinvariantintro ] .",
    "the only problem is that we do not know that the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath282 is non - trivial .",
    "in fact , we do nt even know that any of the off - diagonal kernels @xmath275 is non - trivial . the rest of the article is devoted to estimating the dimension of @xmath458 . at the same time",
    ", we will prove that the representation @xmath495 is , up to isomorphism , independent of all the choices that we have made .",
    "in this section , we introduce two moves that modify the triangulation @xmath36 without changing the isomorphism class of the representation @xmath492 constructed above .",
    "we will then use these moves to prove that , up to isomorphism and sign - reversal symmetry , @xmath495 is independent of the choice of @xmath36 and of the @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 .    unlike in the previous section , the triangulations that we are considering here are not assumed any more to be combinatorial .",
    "let @xmath36 be a triangulation of the surface @xmath0 .",
    "let @xmath69 be the triangulation obtained from @xmath36 by subdividing the face @xmath496 into three triangles as in figure  [ fig : triangsubdivis ] .",
    "in particular , the vertex set of @xmath69 consists of the vertices of @xmath36 plus one vertex @xmath497 in the interior of @xmath496 .",
    "( .5 * -.08 ) @xmath109 + ( .8*.5 ) @xmath110 + ( 0.2 * .5 ) @xmath498 + ( 0.5 * .38 ) @xmath496 + ( 0.5 * -.25 ) ( a ) + ( .5 * -.09 ) @xmath499 + ( .8*.5 ) @xmath500 + ( 0.19 * .5 ) @xmath501 + ( .6 * .55 ) @xmath502 + ( .38 * .17 ) @xmath503 + ( .65 * .18 ) @xmath504 + ( 0.5 * -.25 ) ( b ) +    for convenience in the notation , index the edges @xmath109 , @xmath110 ,  , @xmath111 of @xmath36 and the edges @xmath505 , @xmath506 , ",
    "@xmath507 of @xmath69 in such a way that :    1 .",
    "the sides of the face @xmath496 of @xmath36 are @xmath109 , @xmath110 , @xmath498 , in this order as one goes counterclockwise around @xmath496 ; 2 .   for @xmath508 ,",
    "the edge @xmath509 of @xmath69 coincides with the edge @xmath122 of @xmath36 ; 3 .",
    "@xmath510 , @xmath511 , @xmath507 are the `` new '' edges of @xmath69 that are not edges of @xmath36 , and each @xmath512 is opposite @xmath513 in @xmath496 as in figure  [ fig : triangsubdivis](b ) , in the sense that no face of @xmath69 contains both @xmath512 and @xmath513 .",
    "we assume that we are given a @xmath69enhancement @xmath514 for the homomorphism @xmath5 . by restriction",
    ", @xmath515 defines a @xmath36enhancement @xmath516 for @xmath16 .",
    "we want to compare the two irreducible representations @xmath517 and @xmath518 respectively associated to the enhanced homomorphisms @xmath247 and @xmath519 by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] . for this , we first construct a natural algebra homomorphism @xmath520 .",
    "let @xmath521 be the linear map defined by the property that @xmath522\\bigr ) = \\bigl [ z_1^{\\prime\\ , k_1 } z_2^{\\prime\\ , k_2 } \\dots z_n^{\\prime\\ , k_n } z_{n+1}^{\\prime\\ , \\frac{k_2 + k_3 - k_1}2 } z_{n+2}^{\\prime\\ , \\frac{k_1 + k_3 - k_2}2}z_{n+3}^{\\prime\\ , \\frac{k_1 + k_2 - k_3}2 }   \\bigr]\\ ] ] for every monomial @xmath523\\in { \\mathcal z^\\omega}(\\lambda ) $ ] ( where @xmath524 $ ] denotes the weyl quantum ordering ) . by definition of the weyl",
    "quantum ordering , this is equivalent to the property that @xmath525,\\ ] ] which is a little easier to handle since this second formula does not require us to consider the skew - commutativity properties of the @xmath124 and @xmath526 with @xmath527 .",
    "the definition may look a little mysterious at this point , but will become clearer with the proof of lemma  [ lem : subdivisalgebrahom ] below .    note that the definition makes sense because , if the exponents @xmath528 satisfy the parity condition required for @xmath529 to be in the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 , the parity of the exponents @xmath530 also guarantees that @xmath531 belongs to @xmath532 .",
    "[ lem : subdivisalgebrahom ] the map @xmath521 is an algebra homomorphism .",
    "this is a simple consequence of the description , given in @xcite , of the algebraic structure of @xmath55 in terms of the thurston intersection form on a train track @xmath533 associated to @xmath36 .",
    "the train track @xmath534 is defined by the property that , on each face of @xmath36 , it consists of three edges as in figure  [ fig : traintracks](a ) .",
    "in particular , there is a one - to - one correspondence between the switches of @xmath533 and the edges @xmath122 of @xmath36 .",
    "( .5 * .48 ) @xmath535 + ( .5 * -.15 ) ( a ) + ( .4 * .5 ) @xmath536 + ( .5 * -.15 ) ( b ) +    in @xcite , we interpret the monomials @xmath523\\in { \\mathcal z^\\omega}(\\lambda)$ ] as integer edge weight systems for @xmath533 satisfying the usual switch conditions .",
    "namely , at the switch of @xmath533 located on the edge @xmath122 of @xmath36 , the weights of the two edges of @xmath533 incoming on one side of that switch are required to add up to the same number @xmath129 as the weights of the two edges outgoing on the other side .",
    "the exponents @xmath528 of @xmath537 satisfy the parity condition required for @xmath537 to be in the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 if and only if they are associated in this way to an integer edge weight systems for @xmath533 ; in addition , the edge weight system is then uniquely determined .",
    "this enables us to identify the set @xmath538 of integer edge weight systems for @xmath533 to the set of exponent @xmath539tuples @xmath540 satisfying the required parity condition , and therefore to the set of weyl quantum ordered monomials @xmath523\\in { \\mathcal z^\\omega}(\\lambda)$ ] .",
    "the set @xmath538 of edge weight systems for a train track carries a natural bilinear form , the _ thurston intersection form _ , which provides an antisymmetric bilinear form @xmath541 lemma  10 of @xcite then describes the algebraic structure of @xmath55 by the property that @xmath542\\ [ z_1^{k_1 ' } z_2^{k_2 ' } \\dots z_n^{k_n ' } ] = \\omega^{2\\omega(\\mathbf k , \\mathbf { k ' } ) } [ z_1^{k_1+k_1 ' } z_2^{k_2+k_2 ' } \\dots z_n^{k_n+k_n ' } ] \\ ] ] for every @xmath540 and @xmath543 .",
    "the key observation is now that there is a natural embedding @xmath544 , identifying @xmath533 to the complement in @xmath545 of the three edges that are adjacent to the central vertex @xmath546 .",
    "this embedding provides a map @xmath547 , which is expressed in terms of switch weights as @xmath548 for every @xmath549 . as a consequence , identifying each element @xmath550 to the corresponding monomial @xmath523\\in { \\mathcal z^\\omega}(\\lambda)$ ] , the map @xmath551 is the unique linear extension of @xmath552 .    because @xmath547 is induced by the embedding @xmath544 , the classical homological interpretation of the thurston intersection form as a homological intersection number is an orientation covering ( see for instance lemma  28 of @xcite )",
    "shows that @xmath552 sends the thurston form of @xmath533 to the thurston form of @xmath545 . from the description of the algebraic structure of @xmath55 and @xmath55 in terms of thurston intersection forms , it follows that @xmath553 is an algebra homomorphism .",
    "now that we know that @xmath553 is an algebra homomorphism , we can consider the composition @xmath554 of @xmath553 with the representation @xmath555 associated by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] to the @xmath69enhancement @xmath515 .    recall that @xmath497 is the vertex of @xmath69 that is not a vertex of @xmath36 , namely the one that was added in the interior of the face @xmath496 of @xmath36 .",
    "[ lem : subdivrespectsoffdiagkernel ] the image @xmath556 respects the off - diagonal kernel @xmath557 of the vertex @xmath558 .    by the exponent parity condition defining @xmath55 , each monomial of @xmath55 is a product of constants , monomials of the form @xmath559 , @xmath560 , @xmath561 and their inverses .",
    "it therefore suffices to show that the image of each of these elementary monomials respects @xmath562 .",
    "consider for instance @xmath563 .",
    "its image under @xmath553 is @xmath564 as a consequence , @xmath565 commutes with each of the elements @xmath566 , @xmath567 and @xmath568 associated to the edges of @xmath69 emanating from the vertex @xmath497 .",
    "in particular , @xmath565 commutes with the off - diagonal term @xmath569 of the vertex @xmath497 .",
    "it follows that @xmath570 respects the kernel @xmath562 of @xmath571 .",
    "the same argument holds for the other two monomial types @xmath560 and@xmath572 , and proves the required result .",
    "the following result plays a critical role in our arguments .",
    "its proof uses the non - quantum context , and in particular the off - diagonal equality of lemma  [ lem : classicaloffdiagonal ] , in a crucial way .",
    "[ lem : subdivisiondimoffdiagkernel ] the dimension of the off - diagonal kernel @xmath557 is equal to the dimension @xmath573 of @xmath68 , where @xmath77 is the genus of the surface @xmath0 and @xmath206 is the number of vertices of the triangulation @xmath36 .    by construction of the representation @xmath574 by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] , @xmath575 .",
    "since @xmath576 , it therefore suffices to show that @xmath577 has dimension @xmath578 .",
    "consider the off - diagonal term @xmath579 because @xmath580 @xmath581commutes with @xmath582 and because @xmath583 is a primitive @xmath11root of unity ( we here use the fact that @xmath11 is odd ) , the quantum binomial formula ( see for instance @xcite ) gives that @xmath584 applying @xmath574 then gives that @xmath585 where the @xmath586 are the crossratio weights associated by the enhancement @xmath515 to the edges @xmath509 of @xmath69 , and where the last equality comes from lemma  [ lem : classicaloffdiagonal ] .",
    "it follows that @xmath587 is diagonalizable , and that its eigenvalues are @xmath11roots of @xmath21 , namely are all of the form @xmath588 with @xmath589 .",
    "now consider the element @xmath590 associated to the edge @xmath506 of @xmath69 . since @xmath591 , the linear isomorphism @xmath592 sends the @xmath593eigenspace of @xmath594 to the @xmath595eigenspace .",
    "it follows that all numbers @xmath588 occur as eigenvalues of @xmath594 , and that the corresponding eigenspaces all have the same dimension .",
    "since there are @xmath11 such eigenspaces , their dimension is @xmath596 .",
    "in particular , @xmath597 has dimension @xmath598 , since it is the @xmath599eigenspace of @xmath594 .",
    "this concludes the proof .",
    "at this point , we have two representations @xmath600 .",

    "our last step is to show that the isomorphism provided by lemma  [ lem : subdivisomorphicchefockreps ] is compatible with off - diagonal kernels .",
    "[ lem : subdivisoffdiagkernelconstant ] for a vertex @xmath163 of the triangulation @xmath36 , let @xmath284 and @xmath699 be the respective off - diagonal kernels of @xmath163 for the representations @xmath57 and @xmath574 , defined by considering @xmath163 as a vertex of both @xmath36 and @xmath69 .",
    "then , the isomorphism @xmath700 between the representations @xmath517 and @xmath671 provided by lemma  [ lem : subdivisomorphicchefockreps ] sends @xmath275 to @xmath701 .",
    "we first simplify the situation a little .",
    "the representation @xmath517 is only defined up to isomorphism and up to sign - reversal symmetry by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] .",
    "modifying it by a sign - reversal symmetry if necessary , and by the isomorphism of lemma  [ lem : subdivisomorphicchefockreps ] , we can consequently assume that it is equal , not just isomorphic , to @xmath671 .",
    "in particular , @xmath702 , @xmath703 and the isomorphism is the identity .",
    "note that the modification of @xmath57 by a sign - reversal symmetry does not change the off - diagonal kernel @xmath275 , as the off - diagonal term @xmath283 involves only even powers of the generators @xmath124 .",
    "we consequently have to show that @xmath704 once we have arranged that the representations @xmath57 and @xmath698 coincide .",
    "if @xmath163 is not one of the vertices of the face @xmath496 of @xmath36 that is being subdivided , the expression of the off - diagonal term @xmath283 involves only generators @xmath124 with @xmath680 , and @xmath705 is obtained from @xmath283 by replacing each generator @xmath124 by @xmath526",
    ". then we can choose the off - diagonal term @xmath706 to be equal to @xmath707 .",
    "then , @xmath708    when @xmath163 belongs to the face @xmath496 of @xmath36 , this case splits into three subcases according to whether @xmath163 corresponds to 1 , 2 or 3 vertices of the triangle @xmath496 .",
    "we restrict our discussion to the subcase where @xmath163 corresponds to two vertices of @xmath496 .",
    "the other two subcases are very similar .    without loss of generality",
    ", we can choose the edge indexing of figure  [ fig : triangsubdivis ] so that both endpoints of the edge @xmath109 are equal to the vertex @xmath163 .",
    "then , the off - diagonal term of @xmath163 starting at the edge @xmath110 can be written as @xmath709 where @xmath399 , @xmath421 and @xmath89 are polynomials in the variables @xmath710 with @xmath711 ; namely , these @xmath710 correspond to edges of @xmath36 that are not contained in the face @xmath496 .    similarly , if we start from the edge @xmath506 , the off - diagonal term of the vertex @xmath163 in @xmath532 is @xmath712 where @xmath420 , @xmath626 , @xmath713 are respectively obtained from @xmath714 , @xmath421 , @xmath715 by replacing each @xmath710 with @xmath716 .    by definition of the homomorphism @xmath521 , @xmath717 therefore , @xmath718 the above expressions of @xmath719 and @xmath720 share several terms , and their difference can therefore be expressed as @xmath721 for @xmath722    note that @xmath723 and @xmath724 are two off - diagonal terms for the vertex @xmath497 , corresponding to different indexings of the edges around this vertex . as a consequence , @xmath725 while @xmath726 .",

    "finally , the properties that @xmath741 and @xmath750 \\bigr)_{|f_v } = \\rho_{\\lambda ' } \\bigl ( [ k ] \\bigr)_{|f_v}$ ] show that @xmath756 .",
    "diagonal exchanges ( also called flips ) are triangulation moves that occur in many different contexts .",
    "the arguments in this section are very similar to those used for earlier results in quantum teichmller theory @xcite .",
    "in particular , this section is conceptually and technically much simpler than the previous one .",
    "let @xmath36 and @xmath69 be two triangulations of @xmath0 which have the same vertices , and which differ only in one edge .",
    "we can index the edges of @xmath36 as @xmath109 , @xmath110 , ",
    ", @xmath111 , and the edges of @xmath69 as @xmath505 , @xmath506 ,  , @xmath757 in such a way that @xmath758 when @xmath759",
    ". then , the two faces of @xmath36 containing the edge @xmath109 form a `` square '' @xmath760 as in figure  [ fig : diagexchange ] , and @xmath505 is the other diagonal of the square @xmath760 . in this case , we say that @xmath36 and @xmath69 differ by a _ diagonal exchange_.    ( .45 * .55 ) @xmath761 + ( .5 * 1.05 )",
    "@xmath762 + ( 1.1*.5 ) @xmath763 + ( .5 * -.1 ) @xmath764 + ( -.1*.5 ) @xmath765 + ( .5 * -.3 ) the triangulation @xmath766 +    ( .55 * .55 ) @xmath499 + ( .5 * 1.05 ) @xmath767 + ( 1.1*.5 ) @xmath501 + ( .5 * -.1 ) @xmath768 + ( -.1*.5 ) @xmath769 + ( .5 * -.3 ) the triangulation @xmath770 +    let @xmath152 be a @xmath36enhancement for the homomorphism @xmath146 .",
    "we assume that the following conditions are satisfied :    1 .",
    "the @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 is also a @xmath69enhancement for @xmath16 . since the triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 have the same vertex sets @xmath771 , this just means that @xmath152 assigns distinct values to the endpoints of an arbitrary lift of @xmath505 .",
    "2 .   the four sides of the square @xmath760 , formed by the two faces of @xmath36 containing the edge @xmath109 , correspond to distinct edges of @xmath36 .",
    "the second condition is not essential , but will simplify our exposition by dispensing us from the need to consider many cases , as was required in @xcite . note that we are allowing identifications between the corners of @xmath760 which , for instance , could very well correspond to the same vertex of @xmath36 .",
    "the first condition is really critical .",
    "this second condition enables us to index the edges of @xmath36 and @xmath69 so that the sides of the square @xmath760 are @xmath772 , @xmath773 , @xmath774 , @xmath775 , as in figure  [ fig : diagexchange ] .    in @xcite ,",
    "chris hiatt constructs a natural isomorphism @xmath776 between the fraction algebras @xmath777 and @xmath778 of the balanced chekhov - fock algebras @xmath779 and @xmath780 .",
    "the elements of @xmath778 are formal fractions @xmath781 with @xmath782 , @xmath783 and @xmath784 , and are manipulated with the usual rules for fractions ( except that the noncommutative context can greatly complicate computations , in particular when one needs to reduce two fractions to a common denominator in order to add them ) .    the homomorphism @xmath776 is defined as follows . because of the exponent parity condition defining the balanced chekhov - fock algebra , every monomial @xmath785 of @xmath532 can be uniquely written as @xmath786 for exponents @xmath787 and for a monomial @xmath420 involving only generators @xmath526 with @xmath788",
    ". then @xmath789 is uniquely determined by the property that @xmath790 where @xmath399 is obtained from @xmath420 by replacing each generator @xmath526 with @xmath788 by @xmath124 .",
    "the fact that this really defines an algebra homomorphism @xmath776 is proved in @xcite .",
    "[ lem : chefockcoordinatechanges ] @xmath791    this is a simple computation based on the formula defining @xmath792 : use the property that @xmath793 , @xmath794 and @xmath795 , where the integers @xmath297 , @xmath796 , @xmath797 are determined by the faces of @xmath36 that are adjacent to several faces of the square @xmath760 and are not contained in @xmath760 ( and contribute additional terms to the skew - commutativity relations between the @xmath526 , and between the @xmath124 ) .",
    "see also @xcite , which explains that @xmath792 was designed as a ` square root ' of the chekhov - fock coordinate change of @xcite .",

    "there are again several cases to consider according to which corners of the square @xmath760 correspond to the vertex @xmath163",
    ". we will give the proof in the case when @xmath163 corresponds to two corners of @xmath760 , the one where @xmath110 and @xmath498 meet and the corner where @xmath765 and @xmath110 meet .",

    "the computations of lemma  [ lem : chefockcoordinatechanges ] show that @xmath907 this follows that @xmath908 .    as a consequence",
    ", the isomorphism @xmath552 sends the kernel of @xmath909 to the kernel of @xmath910 .",

    "this concludes the proof in the case when @xmath163 corresponds to the corners of @xmath760 where @xmath110 and @xmath498 meet as well as to the corner where @xmath765 and @xmath110 meet .",
    "the other cases are essentially identical to this one .",
    "we summarize the discussion and results of this section in the following statement .",
    "let the triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 differ from each other by a diagonal exchange as in figure  [ fig : diagexchange ] . recall that we are assuming that the sides of the square @xmath760 where the diagonal exchange takes place are distinct",
    "; however , the triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 are not necessarily assumed to be combinatorial .",
    "since @xmath36 and @xmath69 have the same vertex set @xmath875 , the punctured surfaces @xmath914 and @xmath915 are equal .    [ prop : diagexrespectskeinreps ] let the triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 differ from each other by a diagonal exchange as in figure  [ fig : diagexchange ] , let @xmath916 be simultaneously a @xmath36 and a @xmath69enhancement for the homomorphism @xmath37 , and let @xmath251 and @xmath917 be the representations associated to this data by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] .",
    "suppose in addition that @xmath918 respects the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath919 of @xmath574 and induces a representation @xmath920 , as defined above proposition  [ prop : subdivisioninvariance ] .",
    "then , @xmath921 respects the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath736 of @xmath57 and induces a representation @xmath492 . moreover , @xmath495 is isomorphic to @xmath922 after a possible pre - composition with the action of a sign - reversal symmetry of @xmath4 on @xmath6 .",
    "lemma  [ lem : diagexrespectschefockreps ] provides an isomorphism @xmath881 between the chekhov - fock algebra representations @xmath923 and @xmath518 .",
    "also , theorem  28 of @xcite states that the quantum trace homomorphisms @xmath924 and @xmath925 are compatible with the isomorphism @xmath926 in the sense that @xmath874 .",
    "therefore , @xmath881 provides an isomorphism between the representations @xmath927 and @xmath928 .    by lemma  [ lem : diagexisomrespectsoffdiagkernel ]",
    ", the isomorphism @xmath881 sends the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath929 to the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath930 .",
    "since the representation @xmath608 respects @xmath931 by hypothesis , it follows that @xmath42 respects @xmath458 .",
    "finally , the property that @xmath608 induces a representation @xmath932 means that @xmath933 \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda } } = \\rho_{\\lambda'}\\bigl ( [ k ' ] \\bigr)_{|{f_\\lambda}}$ ] whenever the two framed links @xmath29 , @xmath462 $ ] are isotopic in @xmath44 $ ] .",
    "the isomorphism @xmath552 again shows that the same property holds for @xmath42 .",
    "[ lem : maketriangcombin ] let @xmath36 be a triangulation of @xmath0",
    ". then one can apply to @xmath36 a sequence of face subdivisions and diagonal exchanges , as in   [ subsect : facesubdivisions ] and [ subsect : diagonalexchanges ] , to obtain a new triangulation @xmath69 that is combinatorial , in the sense that each edge of @xmath69 has distinct endpoints and no two edges have the same endpoints .",
    "in addition , any @xmath36enhancement @xmath167 for the group homomorphism @xmath5 can be extended to a @xmath69enhancement @xmath514 .",
    "( note that the vertex set @xmath137 of @xmath36 is contained in the vertex set @xmath934 ) .    by subdividing a few faces if necessary",
    ", we can arrange that any two faces of @xmath36 have at most one edge in common .",
    "after this preliminary step , let @xmath935 be obtained from @xmath36 by subdividing each face , and let @xmath69 be obtained by performing a diagonal exchange along each edge of @xmath935 that is also an edge of @xmath36 ; see figure  [ fig : makecombinatorial ] .",
    "all edges of a face of @xmath36 are distinct by our general convention for triangulations , and we had arranged at the beginning fo the proof that any two faces have at most one edge in common .",
    "it easily follows that each edge of the resulting triangulation @xmath69 joins , either a vertex of @xmath137 to a vertex of @xmath936 , or two distinct vertices of @xmath936 . as a consequence",
    ", @xmath69 is combinatorial .        using the properties that @xmath69 is combinatorial and that each edge of @xmath69 touches at most one edge of @xmath137 , the inductive process of the proof of lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ] then proves the second statement .",
    "lemma  [ lem : maketriangcombin ] and the results of   [ subsect : facesubdivisions ] and [ subsect : diagonalexchanges ] enable us to extend proposition  [ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] and [ prop : vertexsweep ] to triangulations that are not necessarily combinatorial .",
    "[ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] given a triangulation @xmath36 of the surface @xmath0 and a @xmath36enhancement @xmath167 for the group homomorphism @xmath5 , let @xmath251 be the irreducible representation associated to this data by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] .",
    "then , the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath736 of @xmath57 is invariant under the representation @xmath361 constructed in  [ subsect : representingpunctsurfskein ] , and",
    "@xmath42 induces a representation @xmath937 .    by lemma  [ lem : maketriangcombin ]",
    ", there exists a sequence of triangulations @xmath938 , @xmath939 ,  , @xmath940 , @xmath941 such that @xmath69 is combinatorial , and such that each @xmath942 is obtained from @xmath943 by a face subdivision or by a diagonal exchange .",
    "in addition , for every @xmath176 , the @xmath36enhancement @xmath167 can be extended to a @xmath943enhancement @xmath944 for @xmath16 , in such a way that each @xmath945 restricts to @xmath946 on @xmath947 .",
    "since @xmath69 is combinatorial , the property sought holds for @xmath69 by propositions  [ prop : offdiagkernelinvariant ] and [ prop : vertexsweep ] . propositions  [ prop : subdivisioninvariance ] and [ prop : diagexrespectskeinreps ] assert that the property will also hold for @xmath943 if it holds for @xmath942 .",
    "the result then follows by induction .",
    "[ thm : classicalshadowcorrect ] the representation @xmath937 provided by theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] has classical shadow equal to the character @xmath948 represented by the group homomorphism @xmath5 , in the sense that @xmath949 ) \\bigr ) = - { \\mathrm{tr}}\\,r(k)\\ , { \\mathrm{id}}_{f_\\lambda}\\ ] ] for every knot @xmath94 $ ] whose projection to @xmath0 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical .",
    "we again use a sequence of triangulations @xmath938 , @xmath939 ,  , @xmath940 , @xmath941 and @xmath943enhancements @xmath944 such that @xmath69 is combinatorial , each @xmath942 is obtained from @xmath943 by a face subdivision or by a diagonal exchange , and each @xmath945 restricts to @xmath946 on @xmath947 .",
    "since @xmath69 is combinatorial , proposition  [ prop : classicalshadowokcombinatorial ] shows that @xmath950 has classical shadow equal to @xmath4 .",
    "propositions  [ prop : subdivisioninvariance ] and [ prop : diagexrespectskeinreps ] then inductively show that the @xmath951 are all isomorphic , and consequently also have classical shadow @xmath4 .",
    "in particular , @xmath952 has classical shadow @xmath4 .",
    "we now prove that the construction of the representation @xmath937 of theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] is very natural .",
    "[ lem : connecttriangulations ] let @xmath36 and @xmath69 be two triangulations of @xmath0 whose vertex sets are disjoint , and let @xmath953 and @xmath954 be @xmath36 and @xmath69enhancements , respectively , for the homomorphism @xmath37",
    ". then @xmath36 and @xmath69 can be connected by a sequence of triangulations @xmath955 , @xmath939 , ",
    ", @xmath940 , @xmath956 , each equipped with a @xmath943enhancement @xmath957 for @xmath16 , such that :    1 .",
    "each @xmath942 is obtained from @xmath943 by a face subdivision as introduced in ",
    "[ subsect : facesubdivisions ] , the inverse of a face subdivision , or a diagonal exchange as in  [ subsect : diagonalexchanges ] ; 2 .",
    "@xmath958 and @xmath959 ; 3 .   for every @xmath176 , @xmath946 and @xmath945 coincide on the intersection @xmath960 .    for the third condition , note that the vertex sets @xmath961 and @xmath962 differ by at most one vertex , so that @xmath963 and @xmath964 differ by at most one @xmath145orbit .    by lemma  [ lem : maketriangcombin ] , we can assume without loss of generality that @xmath36 and @xmath69 are combinatorial .",
    "the existence of the sequence @xmath955 , @xmath939 ,  , @xmath940 , @xmath956 in this combinatorial setup is then the 2dimensional case of pachner s theorem @xcite ( which of course predates the full generality of pachner s theorem by many decades ) .",
    "in addition , the @xmath943 provided by this statement are all combinatorial .    to construct the enhancements @xmath946 , note that @xmath145 acts on each @xmath963 , and therefore on the union @xmath965 .",
    "extend @xmath67 and @xmath515 to an @xmath16equivariant map @xmath966 ( this is where we use the fact that the vertex sets @xmath137 and @xmath934 are disjoint ) , orbit by orbit as in the proof of lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ] . in this construction , we can require that distinct @xmath145orbits in @xmath965 have disjoint images in @xmath156 , since we only need to avoid countably many values at each step .",
    "then , the restriction @xmath946 of @xmath967 to @xmath968 is a @xmath943enhancement for @xmath16 ; indeed , because @xmath943 is combinatorial , the endpoints of each edge of its lift @xmath969 to the universal cover @xmath147 belong to distinct @xmath145orbits , and in particular have distinct images under @xmath967 .",
    "[ thm : repindependentchoices ] up to isomorphism and up to the action of a sign - reversal symmetry of @xmath4 on @xmath6 , the representation @xmath937 provided by theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] depends only on the group homomorphism @xmath5 , not on the triangulation @xmath36 or the @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 used in the construction .",
    "consider two triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 , with respective enhancements @xmath953 and @xmath954 for the homomorphism @xmath37 .",
    "modifying @xmath69 by a small isotopy does not change the associated representations @xmath518 and @xmath970 , so we can assume that the vertex sets @xmath137 and @xmath934 are disjoint .",
    "we can then consider the sequences of triangulations @xmath955 , @xmath939 , ",
    ", @xmath940 , @xmath956 and @xmath943enhancement @xmath957 provided by lemma  [ lem : connecttriangulations ] .",
    "theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] associates to each triangulation @xmath943 and @xmath943enhancement @xmath946 a representation @xmath971 .",
    "propositions  [ prop : subdivisioninvariance ] and [ prop : diagexrespectskeinreps ] show that each @xmath971 is isomorphic to @xmath972 after possible composition with a sign - reversal symmetry .",
    "it follows that @xmath937 is isomorphic to @xmath973 after possible composition with a sign - reversal symmetry .",
    "conjugating the homomorphism @xmath5 by an element @xmath974 also leaves the isomorphism class of the representation @xmath975 invariant ; indeed , the @xmath36enhancement @xmath976 for @xmath977 induces the same edge weights @xmath182 as @xmath67 in the construction of @xmath251 in proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] . for irreducible homomorphisms @xmath37 ,",
    "being conjugate by an element of @xmath71 is equivalent to defining the same character @xmath948 .",
    "however , for reducible homomorphisms @xmath978 , we do not know if the representation @xmath979 depends only on the induced character @xmath948 or on subtler properties of the conjugacy class of @xmath37 .",
    "we now have associated to each group homomorphism @xmath5 as representation @xmath979 of the skein algebra @xmath6 , with classical shadow equal to the character @xmath4 represented by @xmath16 .",
    "this construction is very natural as , up to isomorphism , @xmath72 is independent of the triangulation @xmath36 and of the @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 .",
    "however , we still do not know that this representation is non - trivial , namely that the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 is non - trivial .",
    "this section is devoted to proving the non - triviality of @xmath49 , and to estimate its dimension .",
    "[ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] let @xmath937 of the kauffman bracket skein algebra of the closed oriented surface @xmath0 associated to the group homomorphism @xmath5 by theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] .",
    "then , the dimension of the off - diagonal kernel @xmath980 is such that @xmath981 where @xmath77 is the genus of @xmath0 .",
    "in addition , the above inequality is an equality when the character @xmath4 represented by @xmath16 is sufficiently generic , in the sense that it belongs to an explicit zariski open dense subset of @xmath15 .",
    "when the surface @xmath0 is not the sphere , the proof of theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] is based on explicit computations for triangulations @xmath36 that have only one vertex . in particular",
    ", these triangulations can not be combinatorial .",
    "this proof is the only reason why we struggled to include non - combinatorial triangulations in the previous sections .",
    "[ [ proof - of - theoremthmdimoffdiagkernel - when - the - surface - s - has - genus - ggeqslant2 ] ] proof of theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] when the surface @xmath0 has genus @xmath982",
    "~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    let @xmath36 be a triangulation of the surface @xmath0 with only one vertex @xmath163 .",
    "in particular , every edge of @xmath36 is a loop . because @xmath0 has genus @xmath982",
    ", we can choose @xmath36 so that , in addition , there is an edge @xmath983 of @xmath36 that separates the surface @xmath0 into two subsurfaces @xmath984 and @xmath985 . because of our conventions for triangulations , the three sides of each face of @xmath36 are distinct , and an euler characteristic argument shows that each of @xmath984 and @xmath985 has positive genus .",
    "we first consider the case where the homomorphism @xmath5 admits a @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 . by lemma",
    "[ lem : enhancementsexist ] , this is equivalent to the property that @xmath986 for every edge @xmath122 of the triangulation @xmath36 .",
    "let @xmath251 be the representation associated to the enhanced homomorphism @xmath247 by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] , and consider the representation @xmath212 as in  [ subsect : representingpunctsurfskein ] .",
    "note that @xmath35 is here the punctured surface @xmath987 , obtained by removing from @xmath0 the vertex @xmath163 of @xmath36 .",
    "in particular , the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath47 of @xmath57 is equal to the off - diagonal kernel @xmath275 of @xmath163 .",
    "let @xmath988 be the closed curve obtained by pushing the edge loop @xmath983 inside of the subsurface @xmath984 , and let @xmath989 be similarly defined .",
    "in particular , @xmath82 and @xmath990 are both contained in the punctured surface @xmath991 .",
    "when endowed with the vertical framing , @xmath82 and @xmath990 define skeins @xmath992 $ ] , @xmath993 \\in { \\mathcal s^a}(s_\\lambda)$ ] .",
    "since @xmath82 and @xmath990 are isotopic in @xmath44 $ ] , theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] shows that the restrictions @xmath996 \\bigr)_{|f_{\\lambda } } = \\rho_\\lambda\\bigl ( [ k_2 ] \\bigr)_{|f_{\\lambda } } $ ] coincide . the off - diagonal kernel @xmath980 is therefore contained in the kernel of @xmath995 \\bigr ) - \\rho_\\lambda \\bigl ( [ k_2 ] \\bigr ) $ ] .    because @xmath36 is not combinatorial , our proof of theorem  [ thm : constructrepskeinalgebraclosedsurface ] relied on the `` drill , baby , drill '' strategy to reduce the problem to a combinatorial triangulation , where we could apply proposition  [ prop : vertexsweep ] .",
    "we will here use a careful examination of an analogue of proposition  [ prop : vertexsweep ] for the non - combinatorial triangulation @xmath36 .",
    "( .6 * 1.05 ) @xmath997 + ( .6 * .7 ) @xmath998 + ( .6 * -.2 ) ( a ) + ( 0.65 * .32 ) @xmath999 + ( 0.1 * .83 ) @xmath1000 + ( 0*.75 ) @xmath260 + ( .12 * .15 ) @xmath1001 + ( .35 * .31 ) @xmath406 + ( .4 * .42 ) @xmath407 + ( .38*.66 ) @xmath1002 +    ( .6 * 1.05 ) @xmath1003 + ( .6 * -.2 ) ( b ) + ( 0.65 * .15 ) @xmath999 + ( 0.1 * .83 ) @xmath1000 + ( 0*.75 ) @xmath260 + ( .12 * .15 ) @xmath1001 + ( .98 * .7 ) @xmath1004 + ( .98 * .27 ) @xmath1005 + ( .96 * .48 ) @xmath399 +    we first need to compute @xmath1006 \\bigr)$ ] and @xmath1007 \\bigr)$ ] . for this , index the edges around the vertex @xmath163 as @xmath983 , @xmath259 , @xmath260 , ",
    "@xmath1008 , @xmath983 , @xmath406 , @xmath407 , ",
    "@xmath1009 , counterclockwise in this order , so that all edges @xmath287 are contained in the subsurface @xmath984 and all edges @xmath1010 are contained in @xmath985 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : onehole](a ) .",
    "the computation of @xmath1006 \\bigr)$ ] given by @xcite can be somewhat complicated , because the projection of @xmath82 to @xmath0 cuts some edges of @xmath36 more than once ; this usually introduces correction factors in bigon neighborhoods of these edges .",
    "a convenient way to avoid these correction factors is to isotop @xmath82 to a framed knot @xmath1011 $ ] whose projection to @xmath0 coincides with the projection of @xmath82 for most of its length , except for a small interval that is pushed across the edge @xmath983 to create a small bigon @xmath1012 bounded by an arc in @xmath983 and an arc in the projection of @xmath1013 .",
    "in particular , the projection of @xmath1013 to @xmath0 cuts the edge @xmath983 in two points @xmath1004 and @xmath1005 occuring in this order for the orientation of @xmath983 coming from the boundary orientation of @xmath82 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : onehole](b ) .",
    "in addition , we can arrange that the elevation on @xmath1014 $ ] steadily increases as one goes around @xmath82 from @xmath1004 to @xmath1005 , crossing the preimage of the edges @xmath259 , @xmath260 , ",
    "@xmath1008 , and then steeply goes down from @xmath1005 to @xmath1004 along the bigon @xmath399 to return to the starting point @xmath1004 .    then , there is no need for correction terms , except for the contribution of the bigon @xmath399 .",
    "more precisely , the construction of the quantum trace in @xcite gives in this case : @xmath1015 \\bigr ) = { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega \\bigl ( [ k_1 ' ] \\bigr ) & =   \\omega^{-1 }   \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-t+1 } z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k } z_{i_{k+1}}^{-1}z_{i_{k+2}}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_t}^{-1}z_{i_0}^{-1 } \\\\   & =   \\omega^{-t }   \\sum_{k=0}^t z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k } z_{i_{k+1}}^{-1}z_{i_{k+2}}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_t}^{-1}z_{i_0}^{-1 } \\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the factor @xmath1016 is the contribution of the bigon @xmath399 .",
    "we will use the computation of weyl quantum orderings in lemma  [ lem : quantumorderatvertex ] to rearrange this expression . by the first case of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderatvertex ] , @xmath1017 = \\omega^{-k } z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k},\\\\ & [ z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k}]^{-1 } = [ z_{i_0}^{-1}z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_k}^{-1}]= \\omega^{-k } z_{i_0}^{-1}z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_k}^{-1},\\\\ \\text{and } & [ z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k}]^{2 }   = [ z_{i_0}^{2}z_{i_1}^{2}\\dots z_{i_k}^{2}]= \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^{2}z_{i_1}^{2}\\dots z_{i_k}^{2}\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] it follows that @xmath1018 \\\\ & =   \\omega^k [ z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k}]^{2 } [ z_{i_0}z_{i_1}\\dots z_{i_k}]^{-1 } \\\\ & = \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^{2}z_{i_1}^{2}\\dots z_{i_k}^{2}z_{i_0}^{-1}z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_k}^{-1}.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] this enables us to write @xmath1015 \\bigr ) & = \\omega^{-t } \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2\\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr ) \\bigl ( z_{i_0}^{-1}z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_t}^{-1 } z_{i_0}^{-1}\\bigr)\\\\ & = \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2\\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr ) z_{i_0}^{-1}[z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_t}^{-1 } ] z_{i_0}^{-1},\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the second equality follows from an application of the third case of lemma  [ lem : quantumorderatvertex ] to @xmath1019   = \\omega^{-t } z_{i_1}^{-1}\\dots z_{i_t}^{-1}$ ] .",
    "consider the term @xmath1020 $ ] .",
    "first of all , note that its exponents satisfy the parity condition required to belong to the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 .",
    "also , @xmath1020 $ ] commutes with @xmath1021 ; indeed , the only @xmath291 that do not commute with @xmath1021 are @xmath132 , @xmath1022 , and a pair of consecutive elements @xmath1023 and @xmath1024 corresponding to the third vertex of the face of @xmath36 that is contained in the subsurface @xmath984 and is adjacent to the edge @xmath983 .",
    "it also commutes with all generators @xmath1025 since the corresponding edges are located in the interior of the surface @xmath985 .",
    "in particular , @xmath1020 $ ] , @xmath1026 $ ] and @xmath1021 commute with each other , and the central element @xmath202 associated to the vertex @xmath163 is equal to @xmath1027 = z_{i_0}^2 [ z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_t}][z_{j_1 } z_{j_2 } \\dots z_{j_u}].\\ ] ]    returning to @xmath1028 \\bigr ) $ ] and remembering that @xmath202 and @xmath1026 $ ] commute with all @xmath291 , we conclude that @xmath1015 \\bigr )   & = \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2 z_{i_2}^2 \\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr ) z_{i_0}^{-2}[z_{i_1}z_{i_2}\\dots z_{i_t}]^{-1 } \\\\ & =   \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2 z_{i_2}^2\\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr ) h_v^{-1 } [ z_{j_1 } z_{j_2 } \\dots z_{j_u } ] \\\\ & =   h_v^{-1 } [ z_{j_1 } z_{j_2 } \\dots z_{j_u } ]   \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2   z_{i_2}^2 \\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr)\\\\ & =   [ z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_t}]^{-1 } z_{i_0}^{-2 }   \\biggl ( \\sum_{k=0}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_0}^2z_{i_1}^2   z_{i_2}^2 \\dots z_{i_k}^2\\biggr).\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    the same arguments applied to the framed knot @xmath990 give @xmath1029 \\bigr )    =   [ z_{j_1 } z_{j_2 } \\dots z_{j_u}]^{-1 } z_{i_0}^{-2 }    \\biggl ( \\sum_{l=0}^u \\omega^{-4l } z_{i_0}^2z_{j_1}^2z_{j_2}^2\\dots z_{j_l}^2\\biggr ) .\\ ] ]    in particular , @xmath1030   { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega \\bigl ( [ k_1 ] \\bigr )    =   1 +   \\sum_{k=1}^t \\omega^{-4k } z_{i_1}^2z_{i_2}^2 \\dots z_{i_k}^2\\ ] ] and @xmath1031     { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega \\bigl ( [ k_2 ] \\bigr )   \\\\ & = z_{i_0}^{-2 } [ z_{j_1 } z_{j_2 } \\dots z_{j_u } ] ^{-1 } [ z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_t } ]   \\biggl ( \\sum_{l=0}^u \\omega^{-4l } z_{i_0}^2z_{j_1}^2z_{j_2}^2\\dots z_{j_l}^2\\biggr ) \\\\ & = h_v^{-1 } [ z_{i_1 } z_{i_2 } \\dots z_{i_t}]^2   \\biggl ( \\sum_{l=0}^u \\omega^{-4l } z_{i_0}^2z_{j_1}^2z_{j_2}^2\\dots z_{j_l}^2\\biggr ) \\\\ & = h_v^{-1 }    \\biggl ( \\sum_{l=0}^u \\omega^{-4 t -
