    "we saw that , for all @xmath1175 , the endomorphism @xmath1126 \\bigr ) $ ] is diagonalizable and its eigenvalues are solutions of the equation @xmath1176 .",
    "since the solutions of that equation are always simple for @xmath1175 , the dimension of the eigenspaces is a locally constant function of @xmath1128 , and is therefore constant by connectedness of @xmath1169 .",
    "we found one point @xmath1177 such that all eigenspaces of @xmath1178 \\bigr ) $ ] have dimension @xmath1086 .",
    "therefore , the eigenspaces of @xmath1179 \\bigr ) $ ] have dimension @xmath1086 for every @xmath1175 .    in particular",
    ", this property holds for @xmath1175 defined by the edge weights @xmath1101{x_i}$ ] associated to the enhanced homomorphism @xmath247 of the hypotheses of lemma  [ lem : eigenspacedimensions ] , which proves this statement .",
    "[ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgenericcase ] let @xmath0 be a closed oriented surface of genus @xmath982 , and consider a homomorphism @xmath5 .",
    "suppose that there exists a triangulation @xmath1180 of @xmath0 with exactly one vertex @xmath163 and with at least one separating edge @xmath983 , such that @xmath986 for every edge @xmath122 of @xmath1180 and @xmath1084 .",
    "then , for every triangulation @xmath36 of @xmath0 and every @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 for @xmath16 , the off - diagonal kernel @xmath980 associated to this data has dimension @xmath1181    the hypotheses on @xmath16 and @xmath1180 guarantee that , by lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ] , @xmath16 admits at east one @xmath1180enhancement @xmath1182 . by theorem  [ thm : repindependentchoices ] , the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath1183 is isomorphic to @xmath980 and we can consequently restrict attention to the case where @xmath1184 and @xmath1185 .",
    "namely , we assume that @xmath36 has exactly one vertex @xmath163 , and that @xmath16 admits a @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 ; in addition , an edge @xmath983 of @xmath36 separates @xmath0 into two subsurfaces @xmath984 and @xmath985 , and @xmath1186 . in this case and with the notations of this section , recall that we have split the representation @xmath54 associated to the enhanced homomorphism @xmath247 as a tensor product @xmath1064   \\to   { \\mathrm{end}}(e_1 \\otimes e_2 \\otimes { \\mathbb c } ) = { \\mathrm{end}}({e_\\lambda}).\\ ] ] of three irreducible representations @xmath1060 , @xmath1061 , @xmath1062    \\to { \\mathrm{end}}({\\mathbb c})$ ] , for isomorphisms @xmath1187",
    "$ ] and @xmath1063 .",
    "in addition , @xmath1066 is the unique algebra homomorphism such that @xmath1067 .    by lemma  [ lem : eigenvaluestensorproduct ] @xmath1188 where @xmath1189 is the eigenspace of @xmath1190\\bigr )",
    "\\bigr)$ ] corresponding to the eigenvalue @xmath297 ( and is 0 if @xmath297 is not an eigenvalue ) .    since @xmath1191 \\bigr )",
    "= \\mu_\\lambda \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega\\bigl ( [ k_1 ] \\bigr ) \\bigr ) = \\mu_1 \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}_\\lambda^\\omega\\bigl ( [ k_1 ] \\bigr ) \\bigr ) \\otimes { \\mathrm{id}}_{e_2 } $ ] , the @xmath297eigenspace of @xmath1076 \\bigr ) $ ] is equal to the tensor product @xmath1192 . by lemma  [ lem : eigenspacedimensions ] , we conclude that @xmath1193 when @xmath1194 , and @xmath1195 otherwise . as a consequence , @xmath1196 is equal to @xmath1197 if @xmath1194 and to @xmath102 otherwise .",
    "[ rem : enhanceonevertextrianggeneric ] if we fix a triangulation @xmath1180 with exactly one vertex and with at least one separating edge @xmath983 , the homomorphisms @xmath16 satisfying the hypotheses of proposition  [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgenericcase ] form a zariski open dense subset of the space of all group homomorphisms @xmath3 . indeed , for a simple closed curve @xmath1204 , many possible arguments show that the set of characters @xmath4 such that @xmath1205 is zariski open and dense in @xmath15 .",
    "[ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgeneralcase ] let @xmath0 be a closed oriented surface of genus @xmath982 .",
    "then , for every homomorphism @xmath5 and for every triangulation @xmath36 such that @xmath16 admits a @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 , the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 defined by this enhanced homomorphism @xmath247 has dimension @xmath1206    by theorem  [ thm : repindependentchoices ] , the dimension of @xmath49 depends only on the group homomorphism @xmath16 , not on the triangulation @xmath36 or the enhancement @xmath67 .",
    "in particular , we can assume without loss of generality that @xmath36 is combinatorial , so that every homomorphism @xmath5 admits an enhancement @xmath67 by lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ] .",
    "if we locally vary @xmath16 , the proof of lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ] shows that we can choose the enhancement @xmath67 so that it varies continuously with @xmath16 .",
    "then , the representation @xmath54 associated to @xmath1097 by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] depends continuously on @xmath16 by complement  [ comp : constructrepchefockcontinuous ] .",
    "the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 is defined as an intersection of kernels @xmath1207 .",
    "its dimension is therefore a lower semi - continuous function of the representation @xmath57 , thus of the homomorphism @xmath16 .",
    "proposition  [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgenericcase ] ( see also remark  [ rem : enhanceonevertextrianggeneric ] ) asserts that the dimension of @xmath49 is equal to @xmath1208 for generic homomorphisms @xmath5 . by lower semi - continuity",
    ", it follows that @xmath1209 for all @xmath16 .",
    "[ [ proof - of - theoremthmdimoffdiagkernel - when - the - surface - s - is - the - torus ] ] proof of theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] when the surface @xmath0 is the torus ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~    [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkerneltorusgenericcase ] suppose that the surface @xmath0 is a torus , and that the image of the homomorphism @xmath1210 induced by @xmath37 has more than two elements .",
    "then , for every triangulation @xmath36 of @xmath0 and every @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 for @xmath16 , the associated off - diagonal kernel has dimension @xmath1211    by theorem  [ thm : repindependentchoices ] , the dimension of @xmath49 is independent of the triangulation @xmath36 and of the enhancement @xmath67 .",
    "this provides us with flexibility in the choice of @xmath36 to perform computations .    by hypothesis ,",
    "the image of @xmath1212 is neither trivial nor isomorphic to @xmath1213 .",
    "a simple algebraic manipulation then provides a set of generators @xmath614 , @xmath615 of @xmath1214 such that @xmath1215 , @xmath1216 and @xmath1217 are non - trivial .",
    "then there exists a triangulation @xmath36 with one vertex @xmath163 , and whose edges @xmath109 , @xmath110 and @xmath498 respectively represent the classes @xmath614 , @xmath615 and @xmath1218 in @xmath145 . by lemma  [ lem : enhancementsexist ]",
    ", this guarantees that there exists a @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 for @xmath16 .    in the chekhov - fock algebra @xmath114 ,",
    "let @xmath1219 , @xmath1220 , @xmath1221 be the generators respectively associated to the edges @xmath109 , @xmath110 and @xmath498 . exchanging the rles of @xmath109 and @xmath110 if necessary",
    ", we can assume that @xmath109 , @xmath110 , @xmath498 arise in this order clockwise around each of the two faces of @xmath36 .",
    "then the skew - commutativity relations satisfied by the @xmath124 are that @xmath1222 for every @xmath176 ( considering indices modulo 3 ) .",
    "the representation @xmath54 associated to the enhanced homomorphism @xmath247 by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] has dimension @xmath1225 , and sends @xmath202 to @xmath1226 .",
    "the above computation shows that @xmath1227 .",
    "therefore , the off - diagonal kernel is equal to @xmath1228 and has dimension @xmath11 .",
    "the hypotheses of proposition  [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkerneltorusgenericcase ] are realized on a zariski open dense subset of the space of homomorphisms @xmath5 . the same lower semi - continuity argument used in the proof of proposition  [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgeneralcase ]",
    "gives the following general statement .",
    "[ prop : dimensionoffdiagkerneltorusgeneralcase ] suppose that the surface @xmath0 is a torus .",
    "then , for every triangulation @xmath36 of the torus and every @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 for @xmath16 , the associated off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 has dimension at least @xmath11 .",
    "[ [ proof - of - theoremthmdimoffdiagkernel - when - the - surface - s - is - the - sphere ] ] proof of theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] when the surface @xmath0 is the sphere ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~      [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelsphere ] suppose that the surface @xmath0 is a sphere",
    ". then , for every triangulation @xmath36 of @xmath0 and every @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 for the trivial homomorphism , the associated total off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 has dimension equal to @xmath1162 .    by theorem  [ thm : repindependentchoices ]",
    ", it suffices to check this for any triangulation @xmath36 for which the trivial homomorphism admits a @xmath36enhancement ; in this case , this just means that every edge of @xmath36 has distinct endpoints .",
    "we use the smallest such triangulation @xmath36 , with exactly three vertices and two faces glued along their boundary .    for this triangulation , the generators @xmath1219 , @xmath1220 , @xmath1221 of the ( unbalanced ) chekhov - fock algebra @xmath114 commute , and the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 is isomorphic to the laurent polynomial algebra @xmath1229 $ ] , where the @xmath1230 are the central elements associated to the three vertices of @xmath36 ( counting indices modulo 3 ) . in particular , the representation @xmath1231 provided by proposition  [ prop : constructrepchefock ] is 1dimensional , and is the unique representation sending each @xmath1232 to @xmath1226 .      the combination of propositions  [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgenericcase ] , [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelhighgenusgeneralcase ] , [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkerneltorusgenericcase ] , [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkerneltorusgeneralcase ] and [ prop : dimensionoffdiagkernelsphere ] completes the proof of theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] .        given a group homomorphism @xmath5 and a combinatorial triangulation @xmath36 of the surface @xmath0 , proposition  [ prop : classicalshadowokcombinatorial ] provided a representation",
    "@xmath1236 whose classical shadow is equal to the character @xmath4 .",
    "theorem  [ thm : dimoffdiagkernel ] shows that @xmath49 is different from 0 , so that this representation is non - trivial .",
    "the representation @xmath72 may or may not be irreducible , but it admits at least one irreducible component @xmath30 with @xmath1237 .",
    "this irreducible representation satisfies the conclusions of theorem  [ thm : realizeinvariantintro ] .",
    "francis bonahon , _ low - dimensional geometry . from euclidean surfaces to hyperbolic knots _ , student math . library 49 , ias / park city math .",
    "subseries , american math . society and institute for advanced study , 2009 .",
    "francis bonahon , helen wong , _ kauffman brackets , character varieties and triangulations of surfaces _ , in _ topology and geometry in dimension three : triangulations , invariants , and geometric structures _ ( w. li , l. bartolini , j. johnson , f. luo , r. myers , j. h. rubinstein eds . ) , contemporary mathematics 560 , american math .",
    "society , 2011 .",
    "francis bonahon , helen wong , _ representations of the kauffman bracket skein algebra i : invariants and miraculous cancellations _ , invent .",
    "( 2015 ) , published electronically , doi 10.1007/s00222 - 015 - 0611-y ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> this is the third article in the series begun with @xcite , devoted to finite - dimensional representations of the kauffman bracket skein algebra of an oriented surface @xmath0 . in @xcite </S>",
    "<S> we associated a _ </S>",
    "<S> classical shadow _ to an irreducible representation @xmath1 of the skein algebra , which is a character @xmath2 represented by a group homomorphism @xmath3 . </S>",
    "<S> the main result of the current article is that , when the surface @xmath0 is closed , every character @xmath4 occurs as the classical shadow of an irreducible representation of the kauffman bracket skein algebra . </S>",
    "<S> we also prove that the construction used in our proof is natural , and associates to each group homomorphism @xmath5 a representation of the skein algebra @xmath6 that is uniquely determined up to isomorphism .    </S>",
    "<S> this article is the third in the series begun with @xcite , devoted to the analysis and construction of finite - dimensional representations of the skein algebra of a surface . </S>",
    "<S> see also @xcite for a description of the corresponding program .    </S>",
    "<S> the kauffman bracket skein algebra @xmath6 of an oriented surface @xmath0 of finite topological type takes its origins in the construction of the jones polynomial invariant @xcite of knots and links . </S>",
    "<S> it can be interpreted @xcite as a quantization of the character variety @xmath7 with respect to its atiyah - bott - goldman @xcite poisson structure . </S>",
    "<S> more accurately , the points of such a quantization are representations of the algebra @xmath6 .    </S>",
    "<S> when the parameter @xmath8 is a root of unity , a celebrated example of finite - dimensional representation of the skein algebra @xmath6 arises from witten s quantum field interpretation of the jones polynomial @xcite , and more precisely from the witten - reshetikhin - turaev topological quantum field theory associated to the fundamental representation of the quantum group @xmath9 @xcite . in the current article </S>",
    "<S> , we construct a large family of new finite - dimensional representations of @xmath6 , while providing a converse to the results of @xcite .    this article </S>",
    "<S> is mostly concerned with the case where the surface @xmath0 is closed . </S>",
    "<S> the case where @xmath0 has at least one puncture is much easier ( at least assuming the results of @xcite and @xcite ) , and was treated in @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> the current closed surface case require many more ideas , and also involves several very surprising properties .    </S>",
    "<S> more specifically , when @xmath10 is a primitive @xmath11root of unity with @xmath11 odd , we identified in @xcite certain invariants for irreducible representations @xmath12 . </S>",
    "<S> it is easier to restrict attention to the case where @xmath13 ; this is no loss of generality , as @xcite indicates how to deduce the case @xmath14 from this one , by using spin structures on the surface . </S>",
    "<S> when the surface is closed , there is only one invariant , consisting of a point in the character variety @xmath15 . by definition @xcite of the geometric invariant theory quotient involved in the definition of @xmath15 , two homomorphisms @xmath16 , </S>",
    "<S> @xmath17 represent the same point of @xmath15 if and only if they induce the same trace functions , namely if and only if @xmath18 for every @xmath19 .    </S>",
    "<S> [ thm : invariantsexist ] let @xmath0 be a closed oriented surface , let @xmath20 be a primitive @xmath11root of @xmath21 with @xmath11 odd , and let @xmath22 be the @xmath11th normalized chebyshev polynomial of the first kind , characterized by the trigonometric identity that @xmath23 . for every irreducible finite - dimensional representation @xmath12 of the kauffman bracket skein algebra , there exists a unique character @xmath2 such that @xmath24 ) \\bigr ) = - \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r_\\rho(k ) \\bigr ) { \\mathrm{id}}_e\\ ] ] for every framed knot @xmath25 $ ] whose projection to @xmath0 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical .    </S>",
    "<S> the character @xmath26 is the _ classical shadow _ of the irreducible representation @xmath12 . in @xcite </S>",
    "<S> we prove a stronger version of theorem  [ thm : invariantsexist ] , which is valid for all framed links @xmath25 $ ] and involves the element @xmath27\\in { \\mathcal s^a}(s)$ ] defined by threading the chebyshev polynomial @xmath28 along all components of @xmath29 . </S>",
    "<S> the above version is easier to state and sufficient for our purposes .    </S>",
    "<S> see also @xcite for a different approach to the key results underlying theorem  [ thm : invariantsexist ] .    </S>",
    "<S> the main result of this article is the following converse statement .    </S>",
    "<S> [ thm : realizeinvariantintro ] let @xmath0 be a closed oriented surface , and let @xmath20 be a primitive @xmath11root of @xmath21 with @xmath11 odd . then , every character @xmath4 is the classical shadow of an irreducible representation @xmath30 .    for the classical example of the witten - reshetikhin - turaev representation @xmath31 , </S>",
    "<S> also defined when @xmath20 is a primitive @xmath32root of unity with @xmath11 odd , the classical shadow of @xmath33 is the trivial character @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> we therefore construct a much broader family of representations of the skein algebra @xmath6 than this historic example .    </S>",
    "<S> as explained in theorem  [ thm : independentchoicesintro ] below , our construction is natural in the sense that it provides a representation @xmath30 that depends only on the homomorphism @xmath5 , up to isomorphism and other symmetries of the data . </S>",
    "<S> we conjecture that , when the character belongs to a zariski dense open subset of the character variety @xmath15 , the representation @xmath34 is the only irreducible representation of @xmath6 with classical shadow @xmath4 . </S>",
    "<S> this conjecture is proved by nurdin takenov for small punctured surfaces , such as the one - puncture torus or the four - puncture sphere @xcite ; it would be definitely false without the genericity hypothesis , as can for instance be proved by combining the results of @xcite with the techniques of @xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> the strategy for proving theorem  [ thm : realizeinvariantintro ] is somewhat unconventional . </S>",
    "<S> in addition to using classical hyperbolic geometry as a guide for quantum topology constructions , it relies on the fact that punctured surfaces are easier to deal with than closed surfaces , and follows the slogan `` drill , baby , drill '' . </S>",
    "<S> namely , we drill punctures from the closed surface @xmath0 to obtain a punctured surface @xmath35 , by removing from @xmath0 the vertices of a triangulation @xmath36 , and the more punctures the better . </S>",
    "<S> if we are given a homomorphism @xmath37 representing the character @xmath4 and if the triangulation @xmath36 is complicated enough , we can then choose additional data at the punctures of @xmath35 ( called a _ </S>",
    "<S> @xmath36enhancement _ of the homomorphism @xmath16 ) and apply the results of @xcite to the punctured surface @xmath35 . </S>",
    "<S> this provides a representation @xmath38 of the skein algebra of the punctured surface @xmath35 , whose classical shadow is equal to the character @xmath39 induced by @xmath4 in the sense that @xmath40 ) \\bigr ) = - \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r_\\lambda(k ) \\bigr ) { \\mathrm{id}}_{e_\\lambda } = - \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r(k ) \\bigr ) { \\mathrm{id}}_{e_\\lambda}\\ ] ] for every framed knot @xmath41 $ ] whose projection to @xmath35 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical . </S>",
    "<S> this last property , proved in @xcite , heavily relies on the miraculous cancellations of @xcite .    </S>",
    "<S> however , there is no reason for @xmath42 to induce a representation of the skein algebra @xmath6 of the closed surface @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> namely , </S>",
    "<S> if the two framed links @xmath29 , @xmath43 $ ] are isotopic in @xmath44 $ ] , by an isotopy sweeping through the punctures of @xmath35 , the two endomorphisms @xmath45 \\bigr)$ ] , @xmath46 \\bigr ) \\in { \\mathrm{end}}(e_\\lambda)$ ] will in general be different . nevertheless , we are able to identify a subspace @xmath47 where @xmath45 \\bigr ) $ ] and @xmath48 \\bigr)$ ] do coincide . </S>",
    "<S> this subspace @xmath47 is called the _ total off - diagonal kernel _ , for reasons that are explained in   [ subsect : classicaloffdiagonalterm ] and [ subsect : offdiagterm ] .    </S>",
    "<S> [ thm : offdiagonalkernelintro ] </S>",
    "<S> let the punctured surface @xmath35 be obtained from the closed surface @xmath0 by removing the vertices of the triangulation @xmath36 of @xmath0 , and let @xmath47 be the total off - diagonal kernel of the representation @xmath38 introduced above </S>",
    "<S> . then    1 .   </S>",
    "<S> @xmath49 is invariant under the image @xmath50 ; 2 .   </S>",
    "<S> if the two framed links @xmath29 , @xmath43 $ ] are isotopic in @xmath44 $ ] , the induced endomorphisms @xmath51 </S>",
    "<S> \\bigr)_{|f_\\lambda}=    \\rho_\\lambda \\bigl ( [ k ' ] \\bigr)_{|f_\\lambda } \\in { \\mathrm{end}}(f_\\lambda)\\ ] ] are equal .    </S>",
    "<S> the definition of the total off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 was devised by wishful thinking , as the largest subspace where the second conclusion of theorem  [ thm : offdiagonalkernelintro ] could hold . </S>",
    "<S> the really unexpected properties are that this subspace is non - trivial ( see theorem  [ thm : repdimensionintro ] below ) and that @xmath49 is invariant under the image of @xmath42 . </S>",
    "<S> indeed , although @xmath52 is defined as a composition of the quantum trace homomorphism @xmath53 of @xcite with an _ irreducible _ representation @xmath54 of the balanced chekhov - fock algebra @xmath55 of the triangulation @xmath36 , the invariance of @xmath49 shows that the representation @xmath42 is reducible . </S>",
    "<S> this reducibility property for @xmath56 would be false if we replaced @xmath57 by an arbitrary irreducible representation of @xmath55 .    </S>",
    "<S> theorem  [ thm : offdiagonalkernelintro ] is proved in  </S>",
    "<S> [ subsect : offdiagkernelinvariant ] and  [ subsect : constructrepclosedsurface ] when the triangulation @xmath36 is sufficiently complicated , and in  [ subsect : constructskeinreparbitrarytriangulation ] for general triangulations .    </S>",
    "<S> a consequence of theorem  [ thm : offdiagonalkernelintro ] is that the representation @xmath38 induces a representation @xmath58 of the skein algebra of the closed surface @xmath0 . </S>",
    "<S> this representation has a classical shadow equal to the character @xmath59 , in the sense that @xmath60 ) \\bigr ) = - \\bigl ( { \\mathrm{tr}}\\ , r(k ) \\bigr ) { \\mathrm{id}}_{f_\\lambda}\\ ] ] for every framed knot @xmath25 $ ] whose projection to @xmath0 has no crossing and whose framing is vertical .    </S>",
    "<S> the following property shows that our construction is very natural . for most homomorphisms </S>",
    "<S> @xmath37 , this result states that the representation @xmath61 is unique up to isomorphism . </S>",
    "<S> however , an additional ambiguity can arise for special characters that admit internal symmetries called sign - reversal symmetries . </S>",
    "<S> the cohomology group @xmath62 acts on the character variety @xmath15 and on the skein algebra @xmath6 ; see  [ sect : signreversal ] . </S>",
    "<S> a _ </S>",
    "<S> sign - reversal symmetry _ for the character @xmath4 is a class @xmath63 that fixes @xmath16 ; characters that admit non - trivial sign - reversal symmetries are rare , and form a high codimension subset of the character variety @xmath15 . </S>",
    "<S> if @xmath12 is a representation with classical shadow @xmath16 , composing it with the action of a sign - reversal symmetry @xmath64 on @xmath6 gives another representation @xmath65 with classical shadow @xmath66 . </S>",
    "<S> therefore , sign - reversal symmetries of @xmath4 are intrinsic symmetries of the problem of finding representations of @xmath6 with classical shadow @xmath16 .    </S>",
    "<S> [ thm : independentchoicesintro ] up to isomorphism and up to sign - reversal symmetry of the character @xmath4 </S>",
    "<S> ( if any exists ) , the representation @xmath58 depends only on the group homomorphism @xmath37 , not on the choice of the triangulation @xmath36 or of the @xmath36enhancement @xmath67 used in the construction .    </S>",
    "<S> in particular , although the dimension of @xmath68 grows exponentially with the number of punctures of the drilled surface @xmath35 , the dimension of the off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 is independent of the topology of @xmath36 . </S>",
    "<S> a consequence is that the construction is natural with respect to the action of the mapping class group of @xmath0 .    </S>",
    "<S> the proof of theorem  [ thm : independentchoicesintro ] , given in  </S>",
    "<S> [ subsect : independencechoices ] , relies on invariance under pachner moves to go from one triangulation to another . </S>",
    "<S> it is a good illustration of the `` drill , baby , drill '' philosophy , as showing that two triangulations @xmath36 and @xmath69 induce the isomorphic representations of @xmath6 usually involves surfaces with many more punctures than @xmath35 and @xmath70 . here , the invariance under the face subdivision move considered in  </S>",
    "<S> [ subsect : facesubdivisions ] , which adds one vertex to the triangulation but does not change the representation , is probably the most surprising .    </S>",
    "<S> conjugating @xmath16 by an element of @xmath71 also leaves @xmath72 unchanged , up to isomorphism . for a generic character @xmath73 , </S>",
    "<S> two homomorphisms @xmath3 representing @xmath16 are always conjugate by an element of @xmath71 and therefore determine the same representation of @xmath6 . </S>",
    "<S> however , for those special characters for which the property fails ( namely reducible characters ) , we do not know if the representation @xmath72 depends only on the character @xmath4 , or on subtler properties of the specific homomorphism @xmath3 representing @xmath16 that we used in the construction .    </S>",
    "<S> it is also quite possible that the need to consider sign - reversal symmetries is an artifact of our proof , and of its reliance on insights from the character variety @xmath74 . </S>",
    "<S> indeed , the characters that admit non - trivial sign - reversal symmetries are precisely the branch points of the projection @xmath75 . </S>",
    "<S> it appears that composing our representation @xmath72 with a sign - reversal symmetry of its classical shadow @xmath4 often produces a representation @xmath76 that is isomorphic to @xmath72 , but we have not been able to confirm this fact in full generality .    at this point </S>",
    "<S> , we still have a major problem , which is that we do not know that the off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 is different from 0 . </S>",
    "<S> this property may even seem unlikely at first , as the off - diagonal kernel @xmath49 is defined as an intersection of kernels of endomorphisms of the vector space @xmath68 . </S>",
    "<S> this question is addressed in  </S>",
    "<S> [ bigsect : dimensionoffdiagonalkernel ] , and provides another one of the surprising twists in this article .    [ thm : repdimensionintro ] if the closed oriented surface @xmath0 has genus @xmath77 , the representation @xmath58 with classical shadow @xmath4 provided by theorem  [ thm : offdiagonalkernelintro ] has dimension @xmath78 the above inequality is an equality for @xmath4 generic , namely for @xmath16 in an explicit zariski dense open subset of @xmath15 .    in particular , the representation @xmath58 is non - trivial </S>",
    "<S> . it may be reducible . </S>",
    "<S> in fact , although we conjecture that @xmath72 is irreducible for generic @xmath4 , it is definitely reducible for highly non - generic homomorphisms @xmath37 such as the trivial homomorphism . </S>",
    "<S> however , restricting @xmath72 to an irreducible component proves our main theorem  [ thm : realizeinvariantintro ] .    </S>",
    "<S> we suspect that the inequalities of theorem  [ thm : repdimensionintro ] are always equalities . </S>",
    "<S> our proof of theorem  [ thm : repdimensionintro ] departs from the `` drill , baby , drill '' and `` more punctures is better '' philosophy , and is based on a careful analysis of explicit triangulations @xmath36 with a very small number of vertices .    </S>",
    "<S> the subsequent article @xcite in the same series proves an analogue of the naturality theorem  [ thm : independentchoicesintro ] for punctured surfaces .    </S>",
    "<S> the results and methodology of this article were announced in @xcite . </S>",
    "<S> see the recent preprints @xcite for another construction of representations of @xmath6 with a given classical shadow @xmath4 , valid for @xmath16 in a zariski dense open subset of @xmath15 . </S>",
    "<S> the construction of @xcite is simpler , but ours is more explicit . in the few cases where the dimension of the representations of @xcite can be computed , these dimensions are significantly larger than those arising in the current article . </S>",
    "<S> we also believe that many of the ideas introduced in this paper are susceptible to have further applications in other contexts . </S>"
  ]
}
